item.title: Making further continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2010, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: On passage, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding Failed by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 143 - 245, 1 Present (Roll no. 2).

item.title: To permit continued financing of Government operations.
Hiring Incentives to Restore Employment Act

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 201 (Roll no. 983). (text: CR H14994-14995)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 201 (Roll no. 983).(text: CR H14994-14995)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 193 (Roll no. 982). (consideration: CR H15005)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 976.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H14994-15006)
On question of consideration of the resolution Agreed to by voice vote. (consideration: CR H14996)

POINT OF ORDER - Mr. Flake raised a point of order against the provisions of H.Res. 976 on the grounds that it violated the Congressional Budget Act. The Chair announced that the disposition of the point of order would be resolved by the question of consideration of H.Res. 976. The House proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the point of order at the end of which the Chair will put the question on consideration.
By direction of the Committee on Rules, Ms. Pingree (ME) called up H.Res. 976 and asked for its immediate consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 146.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3326, H.J. Res. 64, H.R. 4314 and H.R. 2847.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-380, by Ms. Pingree (ME).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-380, by Ms. Pingree (ME).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 3326) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2010, and for other purposes; for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J.Res. 64) making further continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2010, and for other purposes; for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4314) to permit continued financing of Government operations; for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2847) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce and Justice, and Science, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2010, and for other purposes.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 3326) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2010, and for other purposes; for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J.Res. 64) making further continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2010, and for other purposes; for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4314) to permit continued financing of Government operations; for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2847) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce and Justice, and Science, and Related Agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2010, and for other purposes; and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
